title: Anti-Asian Bias Study Due
body:
The Federal Commission on Civil Rights decided today to seek to determine if sentiment against Asian Americans, 
especially new immigrants, has increased in recent years. John H. Bunzel, the commission member who called for 
the study, said witnesses at local hearings had said some incidents were a result of decisions by American 
companies to shift work to Asia. The commission's staff was told to determine by May whether formal hearings 
would be necessary.
Federal Commission on Civil Rights will seek to determine if sentiment against Asian Americans, especially new 
immigrants, has increased in recent years (S)
